_header: Hector of Troy through hard fightings
Note:
Compare Laing (1831)
XLaing, David. The Buik of…Alexander.
Bannatyne Club 46. Edinburgh, 1831, 1834, 402-6; and 6821; first English printing 1722, ed. Thomas Hearne (ESTCT96011); lists copy in printing of Scotichronicon by Law in 1521.
Subjects: Worthies, Nine; chronicles, verse in; translations
_description: ‘Ane Ballet of the Nine Nobles’, translating Longuyon’s Voeux du Paon — an extract of ten 6-line stanzas (aabbcc) from Fordun’s Chronicle

ESROGD5.First Lines:
[H]ectour of troye trow harde fechyngisIn half thirde ȝeris
                    slew xix kyngis…
ESROGD5.Last Lines:
…Ande sum thyme wes set so hardeAt had nocht sex til hym
                    towart [ ]Ȝe gud men þat thir balletis redisDeme quhay
                    dowchtiast wes [in dedis]
ESROGD5.Note:
Part of page torn away at gutter, with loss of text at end of
                    line.

EDU186.First Lines:
Hectour of troy throu hard feichthyngisIn half thrid ȝeris
                    slew xix kyngis…
EDU186.Last Lines:
…At sum tyme wes set so hardAt hat nocht say till hym
                    toward
